author: Summary
title: Common Themes in Children's Literature
text: Beatrix Potter, Rudyard Kipling, and Aesop all employ anthropomorphic animal characters to impart moral lessons, a technique that renders complex human behaviors and ethical dilemmas accessible to readers of all ages.
